help: Brackets is a text editor for web development. It is built on top of web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
shortDescription: Brackets is a text editor for web development.

help: Visual Studio Code is a lightweight but powerful source code editor which runs on your desktop and is available for Windows, macOS and Linux.
shortDescription: Visual Studio Code is a robust editor for programmers.

help: Adobe Fonts provides a collection of +14,000 stunning fonts. It helps creative professionals use type effectively.
shortDescription: Adobe Fonts offers a vast font library for professional use.

help: Font Awesome provides a set of icons and social logos for your website based on CSS and LESS.
shortDescription: Font Awesome offers scalable vector icons that can be customized with CSS.

help: Bootstrap is the most popular HTML, CSS, and JS framework for developing responsive, mobile first projects on the web.
shortDescription: Bootstrap is a front-end framework for developing responsive web sites.

help: jQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. It makes things like HTML document traversal and manipulation, event handling, and animation much simpler.
shortDescription: jQuery is a feature-rich JavaScript library.

help: Angular is a platform for building mobile and desktop web applications.
shortDescription: Angular is a web application framework.

help: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.
shortDescription: React is a library for building UIs.

help: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.
shortDescription: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime for server-side programming.

help: GitHub is a platform for version control and collaboration. It lets you and others work together on projects from anywhere.
shortDescription: GitHub is a platform for version control using Git.

help: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.
shortDescription: Git is a distributed version control system.

help: Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world.
shortDescription: Sass is a CSS extension language.

help: Webpack is a module bundler. Its main purpose is to bundle JavaScript files for usage in a browser, yet it is also capable of transforming, bundling, or packaging just about any resource or asset.
shortDescription: Webpack is a module bundler for JavaScript.

help: Python is a programming language that lets you work quickly and integrate systems more effectively.
shortDescription: Python is a widely used high-level programming language.

help: Ruby on Rails is a server-side web application framework written in Ruby under the MIT License.
shortDescription: Ruby on Rails is a server-side web framework.

help: Docker is a set of platform as a service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.
shortDescription: Docker provides container software platforms.

help: Kubernetes is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.
shortDescription: Kubernetes is a system for managing containerized applications.

help: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.
shortDescription: MySQL is a relational database management system.

help: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system with over 30 years of active development.
shortDescription: PostgreSQL is an advanced object-relational database.

help: MongoDB is a document database with the scalability and flexibility that you want with the querying and indexing that you need.
shortDescription: MongoDB is a scalable document database.
